alert.note: Alert for Sherman (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 21 at 11:43AM CST by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING FOR AN ICE JAM NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM CST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by an ice jam continues. * WHERE...Along the Middle Loup River in parts of Sherman County, particularly in the Loup City and Rockville areas. * WHEN...Until 400 PM CST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding of low-lying pasture land immediately adjacent to the river is expected to continue. Also expect areas of slow moving or standing water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1126 AM CST, Friday, an automated gauge near Rockville indicated a persistent ice jam in the area, with the river level fluctuating around the minor flood stage of 8.5 feet. Minor flooding along the river in the Rockville area was also confirmed by local emergency management. - Because the short-term behavior of ice jams can be difficult to predict, those with interests along the Middle Loup River should closely monitor water levels, as continued fluctuations are likely. The validity of this Warning will be assessed on a day-to-day basis based on gauge readings and ground-truth reports, and an extension-in-time of this Warning is possible in later updates. - Some locations that could experience flooding include... locations immediately along the Middle Loup River in parts of Sherman County. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service.
